{"step_by_step_thinking": "Vasoactive amines are substances that can affect the diameter of blood vessels. According to Document [1], serotonin, a type of vasoactive amine, is released from certain cells and can increase vascular permeability. Document [6] also mentions that adenosine, another vasoactive amine, can increase vascular permeability by activating mast cells. Document [12] and Document [23] also mention that histamine, another type of vasoactive amine, is released from mast cells and can increase vascular permeability. Therefore, it can be concluded that mast cells release vasoactive amines to increase vascular permeability.", "answer_choice": "C. Mast cell"}
